tit.cmt: 林泉寺派→Rinsenji group としました。

sen.j: 石州流林泉寺派(せきしゅうりゅうりんせんじは)は武家茶道。
sen.e: The Rinsenji-ha group of Sekishu school is one of the groups of buke sado (the tea ceremony of samurai family).
The Rinsenji group of Sekishu school is one of the groups of buke sado (the tea ceremony of samurai family).
sen.cmt: 林泉寺派→Rinsenji group としました。
sen.e: The Rinsenji group of Sekishu school is one of the groups of buke sado (the tea ceremony of samurai family).

sen.j: 石州流石州流野村派の分派。
sen.e: It is a branch of the Nomura-ha group of Sekishu school.
sen.cmt: 「石州流石州流野村派」は「石州流野村派」として訳しています。
sen.e: It is a branch of the Nomura group of Sekishu school.
sen.cmt: 野村派→Nomura group としました。
sen.e: It is a branch of the Nomura group of Sekishu school.

sen.j: 将軍家数寄屋組頭野村休成の子である野村休盛が野村派の祖とされている。
sen.e: Kyusei NOMURA (野村休盛), a son of Kyusei NOMURA (野村休成) who was the sukiya kumigashira (a chief of the tea-ceremony division) of the shogunate, is said to be the founder of the Nomura-ha group.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。父子ともに名前の読み方が同じですので、区別するために漢字表記を括弧書きで残しました。
sen.e: Kyusei NOMURA (野村休盛), a son of Kyusei NOMURA (野村休成) who was the sukiya kumigashira (a chief of the tea-ceremony division) of the shogunate, is said to be the founder of the Nomura group.
sen.cmt: 野村派→Nomura group としました。
sen.e: Kyusei NOMURA (野村休盛), a son of Kyusei NOMURA (野村休成) who was the sukiya kumigashira (a chief of the tea-ceremony division) of the shogunate, is said to be the founder of the Nomura group.

sen.j: 久保田藩佐竹家の御用商人菅原新五郎から、その高弟成瀬峯雲が東京で茶湯の教場を開いたのが林泉寺であり、その林泉寺の住職夫人が成瀬峯雲の後をついで林泉派を創てたのが初代家元の福井心月である。
sen.e: Houn NARUSE who was a highly ranked disciple of Shingoro SUGAWARA, a merchant patronized by Satake family of Kubota Domain, started the class of chato (an offering of tea and hot water made to Buddha or the spirit of the deceased) at Rinsen-ji Temple in Tokyo, and the wife of the chief priest of the Rinsen-ji Temple, Shingetsu FUKUI, succeeded Houn NARUSE to establish and serve as the first head of the Rinsen-ha group.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「成瀬峯雲」、「菅原新五郎」、「福井心月」は読み方が分からず、仮訳です。
sen.e: Houn NARUSE (成瀬峯雲) who was a highly ranked disciple of Shingoro SUGAWARA (菅原新五郎), a merchant patronized by Satake family of Kubota Domain, started the class of chato (an offering of tea and hot water made to Buddha or the spirit of the deceased) at Rinsen-ji Temple in Tokyo, and the wife of the chief priest of the Rinsen-ji Temple, Shingetsu FUKUI (福井心月), succeeded Houn NARUSE to establish and serve as the first head of the Rinsen group.
sen.cmt: 林泉派→Rinsen group としました。読みが確認できなかった人名に関しては漢字を追記しました。
sen.e: Houn NARUSE (成瀬峯雲) who was a highly ranked disciple of Shingoro SUGAWARA (菅原新五郎), a merchant patronized by Satake family of Kubota Domain, started the class of chato (an offering of tea and hot water made to Buddha or the spirit of the deceased) at Rinsen-ji Temple in Tokyo, and the wife of the chief priest of the Rinsen-ji Temple, Shingetsu FUKUI (福井心月), succeeded Houn NARUSE to establish and serve as the first head of the Rinsen group.

sen.j: 成瀬峯雲を祖として石州流成瀬派が分派。
sen.e: Houn NARUSE gave rise to a branch named Naruse-ha group of Sekishu school.
Houn NARUSE gave rise to a branch named Naruse group of Sekishu school.
sen.cmt: 成瀬派 →Naruse group としました。
sen.e: Houn NARUSE gave rise to a branch named Naruse group of Sekishu school.

sen.j: また林泉寺派から石州流古閑堂派が分派している。
sen.e: The Kokando-ha group of Sekishu school was also split from the Rinsenji-ha group.
The Kokando group of Sekishu school was also split from the Rinsenji group.
sen.cmt: 林泉寺派→Rinsenji group としました。
sen.e: The Kokando group of Sekishu school was also split from the Rinsenji group.
